title: Chicken Tonkatsu
directions: Cut chicken breasts in half lengthwise and tenderize each piece. Season both sides with salt.

Combine corn starch, flour, cold water, paprika and salt in a flat, deep dish or tupperware. Put panko bread crumbs on a large plate 1 cup at a time as needed. Dredge chicken in wet batter, then place on a bread crumb plate and coat completely with bread crumbs.
Let rest for 10 minutes and make sauce by combining all sauce ingredients. Heat oil over medium heat.
Place chicken filets in hot oil. Fry for 5 minutes on each side or until golden brown.
Remove from oil and place on a plate with paper towels. Rest for 10 minutes and slice into strips.
Serve over white rice. Pairs well with the Creamy Mac Salad recipe.

title: Creamy Chicken & Artichokes
directions: Put chicken, cream cheese and artichokes (juice and all) together in a crockpot.
Cook on low for 5 hours.
Serve over rice or noodles.

title: Deli Ham Sliders
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 F.
In a small bowl, mix butter, mustard, soy sauce, poppy seeds, and onion powder.
Cut sheets of Hawaiian rolls in half and place the bottom sheet in a 9x13 pan.
Layer ham on rolls and arrange provolone slices on top. Return the top of the rolls on top of the cheese.
Brush mustard mixture over the top of the rolls and the sides of the sandwiches.
Bake until rolls are lightly browned and cheese has melted, about 20 minutes.
Slice rolls into individual sandwiches and enjoy.

title: Pan-fried Pork Chops
directions: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat.
Mix together brown sugar, garlic powder, paprika, salt and pepper.
Season the pork chops with dry rub on both sides. Let the pork chops sit in the rub for 15 minutes.
Add coconut oil to the skillet and coat bottom.
Add pork chops and cook until browned and cooked through on each side.
Transfer to plates and serve with vegetables and potatoes.

title: Beef Egg Rolls
directions: Soak rice sticks in hot water for at least 15 minutes.
Combine ground beef (cooked or uncooked), cabbage, carrots, onion, garlic powder, egg yolk, and soy sauce in a large bowl.
When rice sticks are tender and translucent, break or cut them into smaller strings and add them to the bowl. Mix well. Add more soy sauce if needed.
Heat oil in frying pan over medium-high heat.
Wrap cabbage mixture inside egg roll wraps and seal the edges with egg whites.
Place wraps in oil to fry until they are golden brown. Then flip them onto the other side and repeat (approximately 10 minutes).
Remove from oil and rest on paper towels to drain excess grease.
Serve with fried rice and sweet chili sauce.

title: Hmong Egg Rolls
ingredients: 2 eggs (separate whites of 1 egg for sealing wrappers)
directions: Soak noodles in very hot water for 10 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water.
Cut noodles into 3-inch lengths and set aside.
Chop green and yellow onions and cilantro.
Combine all ingredients (except the whites of one egg set aside for sealing wrappers).
Heat oil in a medium to large sized skillet on medium high heat.
Peel wrappers apart gently and put about 2 to 3 tablespoons of vegetable/meat mix on egg roll wrap.

Roll it up by folding one corner over the filling in the center, rolling once, then folding the side corners of the wrapper toward the middle (like an envelope). Continue rolling until there is about 1 inch remaining. Seal with egg white.
Set aside all wrapped rolls until oil is properly heated (test by splashing water — if it pops, oil is ready).
Cook egg rolls for about 10 minutes, flipping if necessary halfway through.
Remove from oil and place them onto a paper toweled surface to drain excess oil.
Serve with Red Chili Sauce or Mae Ploy Sweet Chili Sauce.
notes: Err on the side of caution if you have never used fish sauce. It has a very strong flavor. It can bring a lot of flavor to your dish if it is used properly.

title: Country Fried Steak
directions: In a flat dish, combine flour, 1 tsp of pepper, 1 tsp of salt, paprika, onion powder, garlic powder, baking soda and baking powder. Set aside.
In a separate bowl, mix milk, tabasco and eggs. Set aside.
Cut steaks to desired size. Pat dry with paper towels. Dredge steaks in flour mixture, shake off excess, then dredge in milk mixture. Dredge in flour again. Let sit 10 minutes before frying.
Preheat skillet with 1 cup of oil. Test with a bit of batter or water—the oil should sizzle.
Place two steaks in the pan at a time and fry for 3–4 minutes on each side until golden brown. Do not flip more than once.
Remove steaks and drain on paper towels.

White Gravy: Pour remaining grease into a bowl. Add back 4 Tbls grease to skillet. Whisk in flour and cook 2–3 minutes. Slowly drizzle milk, whisking constantly. Simmer until smooth, 5–7 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve with mashed potatoes and vegetables.
notes: If cubed steaks are not available, use pork loin cut into ¾-inch slices, tenderized. This option is cheaper and works well for large families.

title: Sweet & Sour Meatballs
directions: Spread meatballs across a sheet pan and bake according to package instructions until browned.
Heat skillet on medium-high heat. Add coconut oil and peppers. Cook until tender-crisp, about 2 minutes.
Add cooked meatballs to peppers. Pour honey bbq sauce and apricot preserves on top.
Allow to simmer for 4–6 minutes.
Serve over rice.

title: Chicken Fried Rice
directions: Rinse rice. Combine rice and water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 19 minutes until cooked.
Peel and mince garlic. Dice onion. Heat skillet over medium heat.
Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces. Season with ¼ tsp salt and ¼ tsp pepper.
Coat skillet with sesame oil (~2 Tbls). Cook chicken until done. Remove and set aside.
Increase heat to medium-high, add more oil, and stir-fry garlic, onion, peas and carrots until tender.
Whisk eggs in a small bowl. Scramble eggs in skillet, then mix with vegetables.
Fluff cooked rice and add to skillet with chicken and soy sauce. Stir until combined and heated through.
Serve hot.

title: Chicken Casserole
directions: Preheat oven to 350 F. Melt margarine in 13x9 pan in oven.
Mix 1 ½ packages of crushed crackers with melted margarine in pan.
Season chicken with salt and pepper. Fry in skillet until cooked through. Cut into ¼–½ inch pieces.
Spread chicken over crackers in pan. Evenly top with water chestnuts.
Mix cream of mushroom, cream of chicken, and water in a bowl. Pour over chicken and chestnuts.
Top with remaining 1 ½ packages of crushed crackers.
Bake 40–45 minutes until golden brown.

title: Chicken Pot Pie
directions: Preheat oven to 425 F.
Rinse peas and carrots under cold water to separate; drain.
Melt margarine in saucepan. Stir in flour, onion, salt, and pepper. Cook until bubbly. Remove from heat.
Stir in broth and milk. Heat to boiling, stirring constantly. Boil 1 minute. Add chicken and vegetables. Mix well.
Roll out ⅔ of pastry to fit 13x9 dish. Line dish and pour filling inside. Roll remaining pastry and place on top.
Bake 35 minutes until pastry is golden brown.
Homemade Pastry: Mix flour and salt. Cut in shortening until pea-sized crumbs. Add water 1 Tbls at a time until dough holds together. Form ball. Roll out as directed.

title: Vietnamese Chicken & Rice Bowls
directions: Wash and dry all produce. In a small pot, combine rice, water and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to a low simmer. Cook until rice is tender, about 19 minutes. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve.

While rice cooks, zest and quarter lime. Peel and finely chop garlic. Place chicken in a medium bowl and pat dry. Toss with ponzu, lime zest, ¾ of the garlic, 2 tsp of sugar, pepper and a pinch of salt. Set aside to marinate.
While the chicken marinades, trim and half cucumbers lengthwise; thinly slice crosswise into half-moons. Trim, peel, and grate carrots on the largest holes of a box grater. Roughly chop peanuts.

In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise with as much Sriracha and remaining garlic as you’d like. Seasons with salt. In a separate small bowl, combine cucumber, juice of 1 lime, 1 tsp of sugar, and a pinch of salt. Set aside to quick-pickle.

When rice has about 5 minutes left, heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken (discard any excess marinade in the bowl); cook, stirring occasionally, until browned and cooked through, about 4 to 6 minutes. Turn off heat.

Fluff rice with a fork; stir in 2 Tbls butter. Divide rice between bowls and top with chicken, grated carrot, pickled cucumber (draining first), spicy mayo, and peanuts. Serve with remaining lime wedges on the side.

title: Kung Pao Beef Bowls
directions: In a small pot, combine rice, 3 cups of water, and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to a low simmer. Cook until rice is tender, 19 minutes. Keep covered off heat until ready to serve.

While rice cooks, wash and dry all produce. Core, deseed, and dice bell peppers into 1-inch pieces. Trim and thinly slice green onions, separating whites from greens. Peel and great or finely chop ginger and garlic. Roughly chop peanuts.

Once rice has cooked for 10 minutes, heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add bell peppers and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until softened, about 4 to 5 minutes. Add green onions, ginger, and garlic; cook until fragrant, 30 seconds.

Add beef to the pan and season with salt and pepper. Cook, breaking up meat into pieces, until browned and cooked through, 4 to 5 minutes. If there is excess grease in the pan, carefully remove it by pouring or using a spoon.
Stir sweet soy glaze into the pan with the beef mixture. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Stir in 2 Tbls until melted. Turn off heat.
Fluff rice with a fork; season with salt to taste. Divide between bowls and top with kung pao beef. Sprinkle it with remaining green onions and peanuts.

title: Mushroom & Pepper Jack Quesadillas
directions: Wash and dry all produce. Trim and thinly slice mushrooms. Zest and quarter lime. Halve, peel, and thinly slice onion; finely chop a few slices separate from the rest until you have 4 Tbls. Dice tomato. Finely chop as much jalapeno as you’d like in your pico, removing ribs and seeds for less heat.

Heat a drizzle of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until browned and tender, 5 to 7 minutes. If mushrooms brown too quickly, lower the heat. Transfer to a plate and set aside.

While mushrooms cook, in a small bowl, combine sour cream, lime zest, and a squeeze of lime juice to taste. Add water 1 tsp at a time until mixture reaches a drizzling consistency. Season with salt and pepper.

Heat a drizzle of oil in the pan used for mushrooms over medium-high heat. Add sliced onions and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring, until softened and lightly browned, 8 to 10 minutes. Add ⅓ cup of water and 2 tsp of sugar. Cook, stirring, until onion is caramelized and jammy, 2 to 3 minutes more. Turn off heat; transfer to the plate with the mushrooms. Wash out pan.
Meanwhile, in a second small bowl, combine tomato, chopped onion, juice from remaining lime wedges, and as much jalapeno as you’d like. Season with salt and pepper.

Evenly sprinkle one half of each tortilla with cheese, then mushrooms and caramelized onions; fold tortillas in half to create quesadillas. Heat a drizzle of oil in the pan used for onion over medium heat. Add 2 quesadillas at a time and cook until tortillas are browned and cheese melts, 3 to 5 minutes per side. Cut into wedges, divide between plates, and serve with lime crema and spicy pico.
notes: If mushrooms are not preferred, they can be replaced with ground beef. Pepper Jack cheese can also be replaced with Colby Jack.

title: Chicken Enchiladas
directions: Preheat the oven to 400 F.
Cut or shred chicken. In a medium sized bowl, add chicken, cream cheese, cream of chicken soup, half of the enchilada sauce and green chilis (if desired). Mix until combined.
Fill tortillas with chicken mixture, roll up tortillas and place in a 9x13 dish. Top with remainder of sauce and cheddar cheese.
Bake for 20 to 30 minutes or until tortillas are golden brown. Remove from the oven and top with tomatoes and olives.

title: Chicken Gnocchi Soup
directions: Gnocchi: Place peeled whole potatoes in a pot of water. Bring to a boil. Boil potatoes until they can be easily pierced with a fork.

Strain potatoes and allow to cool. After cooling, combine potatoes, and salt until mashed. Add 1 ½ cups of flour and knead to combine. Add remaining flour ½ cup at a time until the dough is no longer sticking to your hands. Allow the dough to rest for 10 minutes.
Cut the dough into 4 sections. Roll one section at a time into long rope-like shapes. Cut into 1 inch sections.
Boil a small pot of water. Place your 1 inch gnocchi dough pieces into the boiling water. Let boil for about 5 minutes or until the gnocchi float to the top of the water.
Remove cooked gnocchi and place them into a strainer to rest.
Heat olive oil in a frying pan. Put boiled gnocchi into the frying pan to gently sear for about 5 min or until slightly golden. Set gnocchi aside.
Soup: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add celery, onions, garlic, and carrots and saute for 2-3 minutes until onions are translucent.

Add chicken, chicken broth, salt, pepper, milk, heavy cream, and parsley, bring to a boil, then gently stir in gnocchi. Boil for 3-4 minutes longer before reducing heat to a simmer and cooking for 10 minutes.
Stir in parmesan cheese and spinach and cook another 1-2 minutes until spinach is tender. Taste, add salt and pepper if needed, and serve.
notes: If you want your gnocchi to have a fun texture or shape, take each 1 inch dough piece, dip into a small amount of flour, and roll it across a fork or create an indent with your pointer finger. For even more creamy richness, replace one cup of milk for an additional cup of heavy cream.

title: Butter Chicken
directions: In a large bowl, season chicken with salt, pepper, 1 teaspoon of chili powder and turmeric. Let sit for 15 minutes marinate.
Melt 2 tablespoons of butter in a large pot over medium heat. Brown the chicken, then remove from the pot.

Melt another 2 tablespoons of butter in the pot, then add the onion, garam masala, remaining teaspoon of chili powder, the cumin, ginger, garlic, cayenne, cinnamon, salt, and pepper. Cook until fragrant.
Add the tomato sauce and bring to a simmer.
Add the water and cream and return to a simmer.
Return the chicken to the pot, cover, and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes.
Stir in the remaining two tablespoons of butter and season with more salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the chicken over rice and garnish with cilantro.
notes: If heavy cream is not available, it can be substituted with milk.

title: Brown Butter Sage Pierogis
ingredients: 1 tsp salt; plus more to taste
1 tsp pepper; plus more to taste
1 ½ cups flour, plus more for dusting
directions: Cook potatoes in boiling water until tender, then mash with sour cream, cheddar, salt, and pepper to form filling.
In a bowl, combine flour, water, olive oil, and egg to form dough. Knead until smooth, then let rest 30 minutes.
Roll dough thin on a floured surface, cut into circles, fill with potato mixture, and fold to seal edges.
Boil pierogis in salted water until they float, then remove.
In a skillet, melt butter until browned and nutty, add sage leaves, then toss pierogis in butter to coat.
Serve hot, garnished with extra sage if desired.

title: Chili
ingredients: 1 Tbls chili powder (add more if needed)
directions: Brown ground beef in a skillet with diced onion. After beef is completely browned remove any excess grease that may have accumulated.
After grease is drained, transfer it to a large pot. Drain the canned beans and add them to the pot, along with the remaining ingredients.
Bring the chili to a boil. Once boiling, decrease the heat to low and simmer the chili for about 45 min to an hour.
Serve when beans are soft. Pairs well with macaroni and cheese, tortilla chips, fries, baked potatoes, etc.
notes: Rotel can also be used as a substitute for diced tomatoes.

title: Cashew Chicken
directions: Coat chicken pieces thoroughly with cornstarch to ensure a crisp, golden exterior when cooking.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat at 375°F and sear chicken until completely golden and cooked through, approximately 5-6 minutes.
Remove chicken from skillet and set aside, keeping the residual heat and flavors in the pan.
Add additional oil to the skillet and quickly sauté broccoli, onion, minced garlic, and grated ginger until vegetables reach a vibrant, tender-crisp consistency.
Prepare sauce by whisking together soy sauce, oyster sauce, honey, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and chicken broth until smooth and well-integrated.
Incorporate cornstarch into the sauce to create a glossy, thickening agent that will coat ingredients evenly.
Return cooked chicken to the skillet and pour sauce over the entire mixture, stirring gently to ensure complete coverage.
Simmer for 1-2 minutes, allowing sauce to reduce and cling to chicken and vegetables. Add water to create a thick sauce.
Fold in roasted cashews, providing a crunchy textural contrast to the tender chicken. Let simmer for a couple of minutes to allow cashews to become tender.
Garnish with thinly sliced green onions and sprinkle of sesame seeds for added flavor and visual appeal.
Serve immediately over steamed jasmine rice or tender noodles for a complete meal.
